instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) no Power
threads.message:
Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) No power, has been to another repair centre.
History { tried to replace clock IC <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> , <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> replaced 3.3v,5v regulator ,smc reballed ,<CAPACITOR>C5649</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R5689</RESISTOR> were missing and has been replaced but still same no power}
I can see a little jumper from <RESISTOR>R5689</RESISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C5689</CAPACITOR>.
any help would be appreciated .
Thanks in advance.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) no Power
threads.message: Please, post some voltage readings from your board.
